BitcoinZ Black Amber - macOS Installation Instructions
======================================================

INSTALLATION:
1. Drag the BitcoinZ Black Amber app to your Applications folder
2. Double-click to open the app

IF YOU SEE "APP IS DAMAGED" OR "UNIDENTIFIED DEVELOPER" WARNING:
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is a security feature in macOS for apps not signed with an Apple Developer certificate.
The app is safe and has been built from open source code on GitHub.

To open the app, use ONE of these methods:

Method 1 - Right-click to Open (Easiest):
1. Open your Applications folder
2. Right-click (or Control-click) on BitcoinZ Black Amber
3. Select "Open" from the menu
4. Click "Open" in the dialog that appears
5. The app will launch and be saved as an exception

Method 2 - Terminal Command:
1. Open Terminal (Applications > Utilities > Terminal)
2. Run this command:
   xattr -cr /Applications/BitcoinZ\ Black\ Amber.app
3. Now you can open the app normally

Method 3 - Security & Privacy Settings:
1. Try to open the app (it will be blocked)
2. Open System Settings > Privacy & Security
3. Look for "BitcoinZ Black Amber was blocked"
4. Click "Open Anyway"
5. Enter your password if prompted

WHY THIS HAPPENS:
-----------------
This app is built by the open source community and distributed without 
an Apple Developer certificate ($99/year). Apple's Gatekeeper security 
feature blocks unsigned apps by default to protect users from malware.

The app is completely safe and its source code can be reviewed at:
https://github.com/z-bitcoinz/BitcoinZ-Black-Amber-Wallet
